intro: Caucalis longepedunculata var. oligocarpa, commonly known as the slender-stemmed caucalis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The species is distinguished by its elongated peduncles and reduced number of fruits, as indicated by its varietal name. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in ecological and taxonomic studies.
